abstract: Providing a great product or service is not enough; you have to have customers talking about it.
snippet: Providing a great product or service is not enough; you have to have customers talking about it.
lead_paragraph: CROCS, those funny looking plastic shoes. In-N-Out Burger. Google, back before it became a verb.

headline.main: Word of Mouth, and How to Get It
headline.print_headline: Word of Mouth, and How to Get It

abstract: Google is pressing for an extension to the Justice Department’s oversight of Microsoft‘s business practices, which for the most part is set to expire in November, according to a court filing Monday.
lead_paragraph: Google is pressing for an extension to the Justice Department’s oversight of Microsoft‘s business practices, which for the most part is set to expire in November, according to a court filing Monday.

headline.main: Google Seeks Ruling on Microsoft Oversight

abstract: Google loses a round against Microsoft in court, but takes another blow against one of Microsoft’s most sensitive areas: corporate e-mail.
snippet: Google loses a round against Microsoft in court, but takes another blow against one of Microsoft’s most sensitive areas: corporate e-mail.
lead_paragraph: Google’s jabs at Microsoft came on multiple fronts this week.

headline.main: Google v. Microsoft, In and Out of Court

lead_paragraph: For those who are still wondering what all the hoopla surrounding the planned Google-DoubleClick merger is about, Google has chosen to explain. The essay posted on Google’s official blog is, of course, a bit self-serving, as it is a description of how the merger, if it goes through, will benefit everyone from online advertisers to publishers and consumers. In particular, there is no mention of the antitrust concerns raised by some companies, which are currently being reviewed by the Federal Trade Commission, or of the potential privacy pitfalls brought up by some advocacy groups.

headline.main: The Ad World According to Google
